title: 10 Ways to Style Nike Air Force 1s for Women

steps.title: Pair a classic white tee with blue denim.
steps.content: Pair a classic white tee with blue denim. This classic combo and your white Air Force 1s will look effortlessly fresh and chic. Whether you prefer wide legs, skinnies, high waists, or low riders, throw on your Air Forces for an instant look. Give your look a Y2K flair with a graphic tee and some aviator shades. Cuff your jeans for a small but impactful detail.

steps.title: Look sporty and cute with color-coordinated sweats.
steps.content: Look sporty and cute with color-coordinated sweats. AF1s were originally made for athletes, so they go hand in hand with athletic wear. Put on a matching sports bra and bicycle shorts or a comfy sweatshirt and sweatpants to look stylish and ready for a workout. [1] X Research source Some hoop earrings and a simple necklace will add some sparkle to this look.

steps.title: Style up a pair of khakis with your AF1s.
steps.content: Style up a pair of khakis with your AF1s. A little nerdiness blends well into street fashion. Accessorize with thick-rimmed glasses and a bow tie to go full 90s geek (or mid-00s hipster!). Swap the button-up for a blouse or a crop top as another option. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Stay cozy in a loose top.
steps.content: Stay cozy in a loose top. A flowy sweater, fitted leggings, and sleek shoes will give you a trendy silhouette. Bring out your favorite cable-knit and you’ll have a quick and easy ensemble. [3] X Research source For warmer weather, opt for an oversized t-shirt. Tuck it in loosely to get a more high-waisted look.

steps.title: Wear a completely white outfit to look striking and put together.
steps.content: Wear a completely white outfit to look striking and put together. Pair your Air Forces with a white jumpsuit or a romper. If all white is not your style, try all black or all pastels for an equally sleek coord. [4] X Research source Keep up the monochrome theme with white accessories like headbands or pearl earrings.

steps.title: Combine professional clothing with casual footwear.
steps.content: Combine professional clothing with casual footwear. Air Force 1s may have a reputation for the informal, but they’re all-purpose enough to easily mix with more professional clothes. Sport your shoes with a neutral-colored blazer and slacks to truly embody “business casual.” [5] X Research source Choose a blazer with patterns like plaid or a houndstooth to contrast nicely with your all-white kicks.

steps.title: A short pleated skirt is perfect for the summer.
steps.content: A short pleated skirt is perfect for the summer. Match it with your Air Forces for a girly, sporty combo. Fully channel your inner prep with a matching polo and a mini backpack. [6] X Research source For another twist on this look, add a layer with a denim jacket or an oversized button-up.

steps.title: As the weather starts to cool, pull out your favorite oversized sweatshirt.
steps.content: As the weather starts to cool, pull out your favorite oversized sweatshirt. The comfy top, a breezy maxi skirt, and your Uptowns will be perfect for the fall. All you’ll need to accessorize is some hot cocoa. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Pop on your shoes with a day dress for a casual glam.
steps.content: Pop on your shoes with a day dress for a casual glam. Dresses don’t always call for sandals or high heels. Adding sneakers to a cute gown is a 90s trend making a comeback. Try this look with a floral minidress, a long black t-shirt dress, or a denim button-up dress. [8] X Research source Add some drama to this look with dark sunglasses and a chunky necklace.

steps.title: Keep it casual with these closet basics.
steps.content: Keep it casual with these closet basics. A long cardigan and a tank top will match with any bottom from skirts to leggings to mom jeans. White Air Forces will take this simple look to the next level. [9] X Research source Tie on a scarf to complete this outfit.
